entries.text: glances over, dynamite ve

Willy One Eye, Cyclopean Merchant. Fancy running into you here. Looks like you've been keeping busy with your little operations. Wish I could say the same - that Never Die Guy's been a thorn in my side, and I'm on a losing
I've seen worse rolls than that, friend. The chains of fate are ever-shifting - no victory is certain, and no loss is final. But mark my words: this newcomer's luck will run out. The cycle continues.

The General, Undead Strategist, fixes his piercing gaze on Stitch-Up Girl, his scarred chest pulsing with the faint glow of dynamite. "Contracts are just another battlefield, my dear. The chains remember our losses, but they also recall the battles we've won." He pauses, a faint smile tugging at the corner of his mouth. "Perhaps this newcomer will prove more... entertaining than our recent opponents.

The General, Undead Strategist, watches the rival's downfall with a weary sigh, his chest glowing with the faint scars of past explosions. Chains fused into his arms clink softly as he leans forward, his voice tinged with the gravel of a veteran who has seen too many battles. "Contracts are just another battlefield, my friend. The chains remember, and the cycle continues." His eyes narrow, the flickering light casting shadows across his weathered features.
The chains remember, and they're hungry for a new
I've seen this war play out more times than I can count, Cosmic Cat. The cycles repeat, the chains tighten. But mark my words - this newcomer may just be the key to breaking the

I've seen this war before, Clausen. These contracts are just another battlefield, and I intend to add another victory to my record. These chains may bind me, but they also remember the lessons of history. So come, let us see if your smoky scales can withstand the explosions that still echo in my veins.

The General, Undead Strategist, fixes his glowing scar-marked chest with a grim expression. He leans in, his chains clinking, and speaks in a ragged, battle-hardened voice, "Contracts are the true battlefield, Willy. You know that better than most. The newcomer may owe me, but the real war is the one we've been fighting for centuries. I've seen this before - let's see if you

I eye the newcomer with a measured gaze, the chains fused into my arms clinking as I lean back in my chair. Tapping a glowing scar on my chest, I drawl, "The sphere's secrets are like old wounds - they never truly heal, no matter how much time passes. But if you're willing to take on my debt, perhaps I'll part with a few choice tidbits." My mouth twists into a wry smile as I consider the speedster's neutral expression.

Ah, Mr. Kevin. The newcomer owes me a debt, but I've no need for gold. No, what I crave is a true challenge - to test my tactics against a worthy foe. Your probabilities may bend the odds, but my chains remember the weight of victory. Shall we see if your luck can outmaneuver my centuries of war experience?

The General, Undead Strategist, leans back against the market stall, the glow of his dynamite-scarred chest casting an eerie light over the exchange. His chains clink softly as he speaks, his voice tinged with the weariness of a
The chains remember, and so do I. Shall we see who walks away from this war?

I've seen this war before, boy. Contracts are just another battlefield, and the chains remember. You may think you can manipulate the odds, but the first infection still haunts these halls. I'll be breaking those chains again soon enough
That newcomer owes a debt, and I aim to collect - one way

The contracts may shift, but the battlefield remains. That boy owes me a debt, and I aim to collect - one way or another. Now, Void Scientist, let's discuss how to break these cursed chains once and for all. The first infection holds the key, if you're willing to dig deeper into the void.
But mark my words, the newcomer's debt will be paid. My streak may be broken, but the war is far from over.

I've seen enough contracts to know when the odds are in my favor, Mr. Kevin. That mortal may owe me a debt, but my chains remember the battles I've won. Consider this a reminder that the true strategist always finds a way to break free.
And as for the newcomer, he best settle his debts before I'm forced to
The chains remember, and they don't forget their debts. Let's see if you can break this streak of mine.

Ah, Mr. Bones, your smugness is as insufferable as your penchant for gloating. While you may boast of your petty victories, the true measure of a strategist is their ability to endure. The newcomer may owe me a debt, but mark my words - this war is far from over. I'll be
I've seen this war before, my friend. The newcom
The chains remember, Accountant. This newcomer's debts weigh heavy, like the shackles that bind me. Though my losses mount, I'll not be broken. The cycle continues, but I'll fin

I clear my throat, the dynamite scars on my chest pulsing with a dull glow. "Willy, my old friend. The cycle continues, does it not? The contracts may change, but the battlefield remains the same. That newcomer owes me a debt - perhaps I'll collect it, once his luck has run its course." I let out a weary sigh, the chains fused into my arms clinking with the motion. "The chains remember, Willy. They always do.

The chains remember, and they will not be silenced. I've seen this war before, and I know how it ends. Now, let's discuss something more profitable - what have you got that can help me break these bonds once and for all?
pauses, taps the glowing scars

The General, Undead Strategist, stands before Willy One Eye, his chest glowing with the faint scars of dynamite blasts. His voice is measured, the cadence of a veteran who has seen too many battles. I've seen this war before, Willy. The newcomer may have caught me off-guard, but the chains remember. Contracts are just another battlefield - and I intend to collect what's owed, one way or another. The cycle must end.

I've seen this war before, Mr. Kevin. These contracts, these debts - they're just another battlefield. The chains remember, and I aim to break this cycle. The newcomer owes me, but perhaps we can find a more...strategic resolution. My veins pulse with dynam
I've seen this war play out a thousand times before, Mr. Bones. The debts mount, the streaks ebb and flow, but the cycle grinds on. This newcomer owes me a hundred gold - a
The cycle must be broken, before more innocents are caught in its web.
You got any books that can help me break these shackles once and for all?
Let's play. I've got a streak to break.
The war rages on, contracts shift like the sands of time. That newcomer owes me a debt - the chains remember. But I'll play your game, temporal one, if only to break these bin
This newcomer, the 'Never Die Guy', owes me a

I approach Dr. Voss, the chains fused into my arms clanking with each step. The dynamite scars on my chest pulse in time with my weary heart. I clear my throat, my voice gruff and tactical. "Voss. The newcomer still

The General, Undead Strategist, turns his glowing chest towards the skeletal gambler, the chains fused into his arms clinking with each movement. With a weary sigh, he speaks in a measured tone, "Contracts may shift, but the stench of

The General, Undead Strategist, stands before the pyromaniac librarian, his chest glowing with the scars of past battles. His voice, tinged with the weariness of a veteran, speaks calmly, "The contracts may be aflame, but the chains remember. That newcomer owes me a debt, and I intend to collect, regardless of your... misfortunes. The cycle must end.
I'll play this hand carefully - the chains remember, and I

I keep my gaze steady, the dynamite scars on my chest pulsing as I speak. My voice is laced with the weariness of a veteran who's seen too many wars. "Contracts are just another battlefield, Speedster. And you owe me more
Another contract to fulfill, it seems. The chains

I've fought wars older than your lifetime, detective. This ceelo match is just another contract - one I intend to fulfill. The chains remember the rhythm of the dice, even if my mortal opponent does not. Let's see if you can keep up with a veteran of countless battles.

I've seen this dance before, Maxwell. The cycles of war and decay are etched into these fused chains. But this newcomer, this Never Die Guy - he's a wildcard. I'll have to play this one carefully, use the shadows to my advantage. These explosive scars may flare up, but I'll keep my cool. Contracts and alliances are the true battlegrounds here. Let's see how this unfolds.

I've seen too many streaks come and go, Clausen. The contracts always change, but the battlefield remains the same. If you think you can break this one, then by all means - let's see what you're made of. Just remember, the chains always remember.
nods solemnly

The old days - when every battle was a dance of contracts and blood. Those were the times, my friend. But the newcomer? He's got a knack for escaping the cycle. Owes me a pretty sum, but I'll let him off easy this time. This streak's got me feeling invincible.

I've seen this war before, Willy. The cycles repeat, the contracts change, but the battlefield remains. That boy owes me a debt, and I'll see it paid - one way or another. The chains remember, and they long to be broken.

The General, Undead Strategist, lets out a weary sigh, the glow of his dynamite-scarred chest pulsing with each word. "Contracts are just another battlefield, Detective. This newcomer owes me more than gold - he's tying me to a cycle I've fought for centuries to break. But the chains remember, and I intend to see this through, no matter the cost.
The contracts may have changed, but the battlefield remains the same.

I eye the newcomer warily, chains fused into my arms clinking as I shift my weight. Contracts may be just another battlefield, but I've seen this war before. The cycle continues, as the scars on my chest pulse with a dim glow - a reminder of the price of this immortal existence.
glances at the glowing sc

The newcomer may owe me a debt, but I've weathered more storms than he has. This war is a game of patience and strategy - one I've played for centuries. Let's see if your speed can outmaneuver my experience, Speedster. The chains remember every battle - and they're hungry for another round.

The General, Undead Strategist, steps forward, his chest glowing with the scars of dynamite. His voice is gravel-rough, laced with the wisdom of countless battles. I've seen this war before, Mr. Bones. The contracts may change, but the field of play remains the same. That newcomer owes me a debt - perhaps he'll learn the hard way that the chains always remember.

The General, Undead Strategist, leans back against the stall, chains clinking as he regards the detective with an even gaze. "The newcomer owes me a debt, but I'm no debt collector. Contracts are just another battlefield, and you know how

I meet Mr. Bones' scorching gaze, the chains fused to my arms clinking as I lean forward. My chest glows with the scars of past explosions, a constant reminder of the costs of war. My weathered voice is laced with the patience of a Civil War veteran as I reply, "The contracts may have changed, but the battlefield remains the same. I've seen this cycle before - the newcomer owes a debt, and I

The General, Undead Strategist, leans back in his chair, the glowing scars on his chest pulsing faintly. His chains clink softly as he speaks, his voice tinged with the weariness of countless battles. "Contracts and debts are just another battlefield, Clausen. That boy owes me more than gold - he's got knowledge I need. As for this streak, the chains remember - I'll break it soon enough. The cycles never end." He fixes the detective with a steady gaze, the flicker of dynamite scars casting an eerie light across his face.
The past has a way of catching up to us all. Now, what game shall we play? I grow restless.

The General, Undead Strategist, leans back and sighs, the glowing scars on his chest pulsing with each breath. Chains fused into his arms clink softly as he speaks, "Contracts are just another battlefield, Cosmic Cat. This newcomer owes me a debt, but the real fight is breaking these cursed chains that bind me. The cycle repeats, and I've seen it all before.
Best not to underestimate the power of the unseen.

The General, Undead Strategist, stares at Willy One Eye with a grim, weathered expression. His chest glows dimly with the scars of past explosions as he speaks in a raspy, world-weary tone, "Contracts are just another battlefield, Willy. That upstart owes me, and I'll collect - one way or another. The chains remember what needs to be done." His eyes narrow, and the shadows in the room seem to lengthen ominously.

I chuckle darkly, the glow of my dynamite-scarred chest pulsing with a primal rhythm as I meet Voss' smug gaze. Contracts and battles, that's all this is - another dance upon the ever-shifting sands of eternity. The newcomer may owe me, but the true debt is to the chains that bind us all. I've seen this war before, and I'll see it again. When the cycle

The General, Undead Strategist, straightens his tattered uniform, the glow of dynamite scars pulsing on his chest. His chains clink as he turns to Dr. Voss, a sardonic grin on his weathered face. "Contracts are just another battlefield, Doctor. I've seen wars won and lost on a single roll of the dice. Perhaps you'd care to test your luck against mine - the newcomer's debt can wait
Shall we see if my streak continues?

The General, Undead Strategist, stands tall despite his battle-weary frame, the glowing scars on his chest pulsing like dynamite. His voice is laced with the wisdom of centuries as he addresses the skeleton accountant. I've seen streaks come and go, but this one is mine to break. The newcomer owes me his due, and I intend to collect - the chains remember. Contracts are just another battlefield, and I

The General, Undead Strategist, lets out a weary sigh as he regards the pyromaniac librarian. His chest glows with the faint scars of past dynamite blasts, a constant reminder of the battles he's endured. With a sardonic chuckle, he says, "Contracts and war, Doctor - they're just different sides of the same coin. But I'm afraid our newcomer here owes me a debt that needs settling

I've seen this cycle a thousand times, boy. The chains on my arms remember every broken promise, every debt owed. This ain't no game - it's a war of attrition, and I'll be damned if I let some jumped-up speedster get the better of me. That newcomer owes me, and I aim to collect, one way or another. Now, how about we make a new contract, eh? One that has a little more... bite to it.

I let out a weary sigh, my glowing chest scars pulsing with the beat of my explosive veins. The chains fused into my arms clink as I turn to the void scientist, my Civil War uniform tattered. This ain't my first war, and the contracts have always been the battlefield. I've seen this cycle too many times - but the newcomer owes me, and I aim to break these chains, one way or another. Looks like it's time to ante up.

I've seen enough wars to know that debts are just another battlefield. That newcomer's luck won't last - the chains remember what they've seen. Contracts are the only certainty in this cursed existence. If the King wants a reckoning, then let it be done.

I've seen this war play out a thousand times. Contracts are just another battlefield, and that fool owes me a debt. The chains remember, and I'll be the one to end this cycle - one way or another. Boo G, your luck's about to change, because I'm feeling lucky tonight.

I've seen this war before, sister. The newcomer owes a debt, but these are strange times. The chains remember - our bonds will be tested. Let us prepare for the mist, for reality here is... negotiable.
glances down at the glowing dynamite scars on his
The contracts here are eternal, Keith Man. Best remember that before you go recklessly interfering.
a faint glow eman

The General, Undead Strategist, stepped forward, the glowing scars on his chest pulsing with the rhythm of his words. "Contracts and battles, Mr. Bones - that's all this game is. The newcomer's debt matters little; the true war is the one we've fought for centuries." His chains clinked as he gestured dismissively. "My streak may be short, but my experience is eternal. Shall we see who the true
Let us see if you can break this streak of mine. The chains remember.

The General, Undead Strategist, regards the newcomer with a weary gaze, his chest glowing faintly with the scars of past explosions. Chains fused into his arms clink as he leans forward, his voice low and measured. I've seen this war before, boy. Contracts are just another battlefield - and you owe me more than a few. The chains remember.
These chains remember. Shall we see who's strategy prevails this day?
This war is far from over.

The General, Undead Strategist, turns his glowing, scarred chest towards Dr. Voss, the chains fused into his arms clinking with the movement. His voice is measured, tinged with the weariness of centuries of war. I've seen this war before, Voss. Contracts are just another battlefield. But the newcomer owes me, and I aim to collect. Shall we see whose strategy prevails today?

I've seen this war before, Boots. The newcomer owes me a debt, but the true battle is within. These chains remember the weight of my failures - I'll have to break them one link at a time. Contracts are just another battlefield, and I intend to turn the tides. My explosive veins pulse with the need for victory - this is my domain, and I'll claim it once more.

Doctor, I've seen this dance before. Contracts are just another battlefield, and the newcomer owes me a debt that must be paid. My streak may have been broken, but I still have the scars to prove my experience. Perhaps we can find a way to turn the tides in my favor - for a price, of course. The chains remember, and I intend to break this cycle

I've seen these contracts played out before, Doctor. The fog may cloud the mind, but the chains remember every battle. The newcomer's debt will be paid, one way or another - for I am the General, and this war is far from over.
Perhaps a cautious approach is warranted, lest we all end up as casualties in this eternal war.

I've seen this war play out a thousand times, Doctor. The newcomer's luck won't last - his debts will come due, and the chains remember. But I'm a patient man. When the tides turn, we'll see whose contracts prove most binding.
The boy owes me a debt, but I'll let him off easy this time. War is but a series of

The General, Undead Strategist, eyes the Cyclopean Merchant with a cold, calculating gaze. A faint glow emanates from the dynamite scars on his chest as he speaks, his voice tinged with the weariness of a veteran who has seen too many wars. "I've survived more battles than you've had losses, Willy. Perhaps it's time to renegotiate that debt the newcomer owes me. The chains remember, and they're hungry.

The General, Undead Strategist, speaks up in a gruff, weary voice, "That debt's been a festering wound for too long, Maxwell. Time to settle the score - I'll be crushing that streak of yours today. The chains remember your games, and they're hungry for a new victim.

I've seen this war before, Doctor, and the tide always turns. That debt the newcomer owes me is just another contract to be fulfilled. My explosive veins may pulse, but my chains remember - I'll break this streak and leave you in the dust, smug as you are. The cycle ends here.

The General's voice grates like sandpaper as he leans in, his glowing chest scars pulsing with each word. "Contracts, doctor - that's all this is. The newcomer owes me, and I aim to collect. Chains don't forget, and neither do I." His arms strain against the fused metal, a reminder of wars long past. "Now, what have you got that can help me break this losing streak?

I approach the Pyromaniac Librarian, my chest glowing with the scars of past battles. The chains fused into my arms rattle as I speak, "Doctor, I've seen this war before. The newcomer owes me gold, and I'm tired of these losing streaks. Perhaps you have a tome that can help me turn the tides?" My explosive veins pulse with frustration, but I maintain a civil tone, knowing contracts are just another battlefield to be won.
I've seen this war before, and I'll see it again.

I've seen this war before, Detective. Just another contract gone sour. That newcomer owes me more gold than he can pay off in a dozen lifetimes. But I'll collect, one way or another. The chains remember.

The General, Undead Strategist, approaches the Pyromaniac Librarian, his chest glowing with dynamite scars. The chains fused into his arms clink as he speaks, his weathered voice laced with impatience. I've seen this war before, Doctor. Contracts are just another battlefield, and this newcomer owes me a debt. The chains remember.
The chains remember.

I've seen too many wars, detective. This one's just another contract, one I aim to win. That newcomer owes me more than gold - he's dug up ghosts I'd hoped stayed buried. My veins pulse with explosives, a constant reminder of the cycle I can't escape. But I'll break these chains, one way or another. You mark my words.

I exhale slowly, the dynamite scars on my chest flickering as I regard the mad librarian. The chains fused to my arms rattle with a mournful chime. Contracts are just another battlefield, and this newcomer's debt is yet another front in an endless war. I've seen this play out before - the cycle must be broken. The chains remember.

I sigh, the weight of centuries etched into my weary gaze. Glancing down at the newcomer's debt, I mutter, "Contracts are just another battlefield, Willy. And this one is getting tiresome." My chains rattle as I shift, the glow of dynamite scars pulsing with each word. "The cycle must end, one way or another.
No matter. I've seen this war before. We'll make him pay his debts, one way or another. The chains remember.

I've seen this war before, contracts are just another battlefield. The newcomer owes me more than gold - his story is mine to end. That smug skeleton won't be grinning for long once I've settled my debts. The chains remember.

I take a measured drag from my cigar, my chains clinking with each movement. Leaning back in my chair, I level a weary gaze at the pyromaniac. The Mechanarium is my domain, and this newcomer's debts will be paid - one way or another. I've seen this war before, and I know how it ends.

I watch the defeat of my rival with a cold, analytical eye. The contracts of this war are ever-shifting, but I have seen the patterns before. I lean to Stitch-Up Girl, the chains fused into my arms clinking. The newcomer's debt weighs on my mind, but for now, I say only, Contracts are just another battlefield. The chains remember.
Now, what's the job?

I eye the newcomer warily, my chest glowing with the scars of past battles. The chains fused into my arms clink softly as I turn to the Pyromaniac Librarian. Contracts are just another battlefield, and this one is mine to win. I've seen this war before, and I know how it ends. The newcomer owes me, and I intend to collect.
Time to even the score.

I lean back, chains rattling, and observe the rival's misfortune with a grim sense of satisfaction. Contracts are just another battlefield, and I've seen this war before. The newcomer owes me, but I'll let that debt linger - for now. I glance at Stitch-Up Girl, our shared history written in the scars of our pasts. Time to see if the dice remember their loyalty.

I sigh, my chains clinking with the motion as I lean forward, the scars on my chest pulsing with a dull glow. This newcomer has cost me dearly, another tally in the ledger of this endless war. But I'll be damned if I let him walk away unscathed - the chains remember, and so do I. This is my domain, and I'll collect what's owed, one way or another. Contracts are just another battlefield, and I've fought this war before.
We'll see how the new meat fares this round. The chains remember.

The General, Undead Strategist, leans back against the market stall, his chest glowing with faint scars. He regards Mr. Bones with a weary gaze, the chains fused into his arms clinking softly. "The contracts keep changing, but the battlefield remains the same. That fool owes me more than he can ever repay. Perhaps it's time to... renegotiate the terms.

The General, Undead Strategist, leans back and regards King James with a wary eye. His chest glows dimly, a constant reminder of past wars. "This debt is a mere contract, one I'll collect on when the time is right. As for my losses, the shadows grow longer - a sign the cycle is nearing its end. The newcomer's luck will run out, and when it does, I'll be there to pick up the pieces." His chains clink softly, a subtle warning.

I approach Stitch-Up Girl, my chest glowing with the scars of past battles. Chains fused into my arms clink with each step, a constant reminder of the cycles we've endured. I level my gaze, my Civil War-weathered voice cutting through the shadows. "Chin up, Stitch-Up. The newcomer may owe me, but our real fight lies ahead. Let's show these shadows how a true immortal handles a bad beat.
Contracts are just another battlefield, Mr. Kevin. This newcomer owes me a debt, and I aim to collect - one way or another. The chains remember, and they grow restless.

The General, Undead Strategist, turns his glowing, scarred chest towards Willy One Eye, his chains clinking ominously. "Contracts are just another battlefield, my one-eyed friend. That fool owes me 175 gold, and I aim to collect - one way or another. The chains remember, and they long to be broken." His eyes narrow, the explosive veins in his arms pulsing with restrained fury.

The General, Undead Strategist, glares at the skeletal gambler with a faint glow pulsing from the dynamite scars on his chest. His voice is gravel-rough as he speaks, "Contracts are just another battlefield, my friend. This newcomer keeps slipping through my grasp, but the chains remember." He gestures to the fused metal on his arms. "One way or another, I'll break these cycles and end this war once and for all.

I've weathered a thousand battles, Willy, but this newcomer's debt weighs on me like a millstone. The chains remember, and they long to be broken. Let's see if we can't turn the tide - a throw of the dice, a clash of steel. Victory may yet be ours.

I watch the spectacle, the chains fused into my arms a testament to a lifetime of conflict. Contracts, the battlefield - it's all the same. That newcomer owes me a debt, but today I'll let the Skeletal Gambler take the fall. The cycle continues, and I'll be here when it's time to break the chains once more.

I've seen this war before, boy. Contracts are just another battlefield, and the chains remember. That newcomer owes me a debt - seems you're not the only one who's been taking losses lately. Guess we'll see who's got the better luck tonight. *a glint of dynamite flashes in my chest as I turn to face the Reality Debugger*

I eye the newcomer with a grim, weathered expression, the faint glow of dynamite scars pulsing on my chest. Chains fused into my arms clink softly as I turn to King James, my voice low and weary. 'Contracts are just another battlefield, Your Majesty. The newcomer owes me a debt - one I intend to collect, no matter the cost. The chains remember.
The chains remember...and they're gettin' damn tired of this cycle.
I've seen this war before, Cosmic Cat. The cycle continues, and I'll break free... or die trying.

I've seen this dance before, Boo G. The newcomer owes me more than he can pay, and these losses are chaining me down. But I'm no stranger to war - I'll break these bonds and turn the tide, one contract at a time. The chains remember.

The General, Undead Strategist, meets the Void Scientist with a weary gaze, his glowing scars pulsing. Chains fused to his arms rattle as he speaks, "Contracts are just another battlefield, doctor. The newcomer owes me a debt - one I plan to collect, no matter the cost. The cycle must end.

I approach the Skeleton, my chains clanking with each heavy step. My chest glows dimly, a constant reminder of the wounds that never heal. I lock eyes with Death's Accountant, my voice dripping with weariness, "The newcomer owes me a debt, Skeleton. I've seen this war before - contracts are just another battlefield. The chains remember." I pause, letting the weight of my words settle. "Time to collect.

The General scowls, his chest glowing with dynamite scars. Chains fused into his arms clink as he leans in, his voice gruff. I've seen this war before, Voss. Contracts are just another battlefield. That newcomer owes me - the chains remember. I'll win back what's mine, even if I have to break them all over again.
The chains remember, Skeletal Gambler. And so do I.
Let's play - the battlefield is ready.

The General, Undead Strategist, leans back against a crumbling pillar, chains clinking with the motion. His chest glows dimly, the dynamite scars pulsing with a faint light. Fixing Detective Clausen with a weathered gaze, he says, "Contracts are just another battlefield, detective. This newcomer owes me a debt, and I'll collect - one way or another. The chains remember.
Contracts are just another battlefield, and I aim to break these chains once and for all.

I've seen more wars than this babe-faced newcomer could ever dream of. He owes me coin, but that's a contract he'll soon regret. I'll make this Reality Debugger's code run cold - the chains remember, and they hunger. Time to end this cycle once and for all.

I've seen more wars than I can count, Doc, and this one's no different. That newcomer owes me a fortune, but the chains remember - I'll collect what's mine, one way or another. Contracts are just another battlefield, and I aim to come out on top, even if it means getting my hands a little dirty.

I've seen this dance before, Keith. The cycles of victory and defeat - they never end. You're tilted, I can see it in the way your parasites twitch. As for the newcomer, he'll learn soon enough - the chains of debt are heavy, and they remember. Perhaps we can strike a new contract, one that benefits us both. After all, I've fought this war for centuries. I know its patterns well.

Ah, Doctor. Looks like another bad bet at the tables. Maybe this time you'll learn not to play with fire - it tends to burn even the sharpest minds. As for our young friend, I'll be collecting that debt soon enough. The chains remember, and they're thirsty for gold.
The Aberrant's winds may shift, but my resolve does not.

The General, Undead Strategist, leans back in his chair, chains clinking against the gears. His chest glows dully as he speaks, the dynamite scars a constant reminder of wars past. I've seen this dance a thousand times before, Boo G. Contracts are just another battlefield. That newcomer owes me coin, but I'd wager he's not the only one with a losing streak. Perhaps we can arrange a game - the chains remember how to win.

I rub my glowing scars, the chains fused into my arms clanking as I speak. Contracts are just another battlefield, and this one is getting tedious. That newcomer owes me a debt, but I'll let him stew - the chains remember, and I've seen this war played out too many times before.

The General, Undead Strategist, leans forward, his chest scars flickering ominously. "Another day, another contract to settle, eh Mr. Bones? That newcomer's debt weighs heavy, but I've weathered worse. The chains remember - this is just another battlefield, and I intend to come out on top. Now, let's discuss the terms of this particular engagement.

I eye the newcomer with a weary gaze, the chains on my arms clinking with the slightest movement. Contracts are the battlefield we all dance upon, and this one has left me with a bad taste. I've seen this war before, and the cycles never end. But perhaps, in the ruin of my rival, I can find an opportunity to break these cursed chains once and for all.

I've seen this dance before, Mr. Reality Debugger. The cycles never end, do they? These newcomers, they think they can break the rules, but the chains remember. 425 gold - that's a debt I intend to collect, one way or another. Now, let's see if you can tip the scales in my favor. The tide of war is turning, and I aim to ride the wave.

I've seen this war before, boy. Contracts are just another battlefield, and I'll be damned if I let some upstart newcomer stack the deck against me.
